creator: jason.harris@cwb.com
text:
Tag Libraries do not work with 3.2.1 but do work with 3.2. This includes the 
example examples\jsp\simpletag\foo.jsp. The exception thrown is as below:
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.TagLibraryInfoImpl.createAttribute
(TagLibraryInfoImpl.java:524)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.TagLibraryInfoImpl.createTagInfo
(TagLibraryInfoImpl.java:432)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.TagLibraryInfoImpl.parseTLD
(TagLibraryInfoImpl.java:385)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.TagLibraryInfoImpl.
(TagLibraryInfoImpl.java:233)
...etc.

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
I am not able to dumplicate this bug.  The foo.jsp and other tag libraries
work for me in Tomcat 3.2.1.

creator: imaginejek@hotmail.com
text:
This bug occurs for me when trying to run the jsp scrape tag library examples 
under tomcat 3.2.1.  Searching for "TagAttributeInfo" on Apache javadocs shows 
the signature of its constructor changed sometime from TagAttributeInfo
(java.lang.String name, boolean required, boolean rtexprvalue, java.lang.String 
type, boolean reqTime) [5 parameters] to TagAttributeInfo(java.lang.String 
name, boolean required, java.lang.String type, boolean reqTime) [4 parameters].

creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
The TagAttributeInfo constructor in jakarta-servlet matches the JSP 1.1 
specification (see 
http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/jsp/tagext/TagAtt
ributeInfo.html)

I don't see a version of TagAttributeInfo.java anywhere in the history of the 
jakarta-servletapi repository that had a constructor like you describe.  Make 
sure your using the servlet.jar that ships with Tomcat.
